notesStmt.note: Grier notes that "the writing seems to be WW's handwriting of the 1850s" (Walt Whitman: Notebooks and Unpublished Manuscripts, ed. Edward F. Grier [New York: New York University Press, 1984], 5:1750.) Item is pasted down, making the verso unavailable.

body.ab: Richard Burbage, principal owner in theatretheater, & principal actor of first parts, must have been quite a character —he was quite rich— died in 1619—(worth Â£300 a year)
